meanings.definition: A loud, heavy sound or thud.
meanings.sent1: The kathump of the falling tree echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I heard a kathump when the book fell off the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The kathump of the basketball hitting the ground made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The kathump of the hammer hitting the nail was music to his ears.
meanings.sent5: The kathump of the thunderstorm made the windows rattle.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, heavy sound or thud.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally kathumped the door closed behind me.
meanings.sent2: The heavy box kathumped onto the floor when I dropped it.
meanings.sent3: The chef kathumped the dough on the counter to knead it.
meanings.sent4: The old clock kathumped loudly as it struck midnight.
meanings.sent5: The horse's hooves kathumped on the dirt road as it galloped away.
